DOC.brief_summary: UPGRADE aims to see whether data from Pharmacogenomic Testing (PGx) can help physicians manage patient medication regimens and assess if the testing has an effect on reducing adverse drug reactions, hospitalizations and emergency department visits. The way an individual processes a drug is in part determined by their genes, and there is known to be genetic variation between humans in the way drugs are metabolized. The study of the way genes affect a person's response to drugs is known as "Pharmacogenomics."
DOC.brief_title: Utility of PharmacoGenomics for Reducing Adverse Drug Effects
DOC.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
